content.text: This chapter governs water supply and distribution in buildings.
Design shall ensure adequate flow, pressure, and temperature, and shall avoid contamination.
Every fixture shall be connected to a water supply system with sufficient volume and pressure.
Approved piping materials include copper, CPVC, PEX, galvanized steel, and others as specified.
Pipe used for water distribution shall comply with NSF 61 and relevant ASTM standards.
No threaded connections allowed on copper tubing.
All fittings must be compatible with the piping and materials used.
(Additional sections on valves, backflow, and installation rules would follow.)
